meta.content: Chesterfield County School District is located in Chesterfield, SC and consists of 19 schools.

section.class: content-container news1-container slick-container content-size-small orientation-horizontal thumbnail-orientation-vertical

div.div: We would like to update you on the pickup of this week’s instructional packets at your schools. Instructional packets can be picked up Wednesday, April 29th. Packets will include work for April 29th through May 12th. All previous work that is completed should be turned in when you come to pick up new packets. Please follow the directions provided at each school. Thank you for your cooperation as we work through this unusual situation.

The exceptional Food Services Department of Chesterfield County School District will continue to have those healthy meals available for the children of Chesterfield County. For the week of April 27th, meals will be available beginning tomorrow, Monday through Wednesday. Breakfast and lunch for Thursdays and Fridays will also be given out on Wednesdays. The locations and service times for meal services remain the same and include the following locations and service times:

h3.a: Wifi to be available through buses

div.div: Good afternoon Chesterfield County School District Families: Beginning Monday, April 27, in coordination with the SC Department of Education, Chesterfield County School District will be deploying six school buses, now equipped with WiFi, at the same school sites where our meals are being distributed. As a reminder, those school sites are Petersburg Primary, Jefferson Elementary, McBee Elementary, Plainview Elementary, Cheraw Intermediate, and Chesterfield-Ruby Middle.

h3.a: April 23 update: schools cancelled for the rest of the year

div.div: Dear CCSD parents: as you probably know, the governor has cancelled all S.C. schools for the rest of the year. Our meal programs will continue through at least the end of May. Also, learning packages will continue to be distributed and returned. We realize that there are a lot of questions about graduations, particularly at our four high schools. We are still working on those plans.

img.alt: Teacher Residency program available for Chesterfield County Featured Photo

h3.a: Teacher Residency program available for Chesterfield County

div.div: The Teacher Residency program is a graduate program (earn a Master of Arts in Teaching from Winthrop University) and path to teacher certification for people with non-education undergraduate degrees who are interested in becoming teachers in a number of school districts, including Chesterfield County. The program offers potential candidates a year-long residency, $20,000 living expense stipend, and a guaranteed teaching job in the participating district with successful completion of the program.
